title: Extreme Sports Medicine Education Design: Collaborative Autoethnography-Based Simulation/VR Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical and physical education knowledge, and foundational skills in mathematical data analysis
context.additional_context: Enhancing pre-service teachers' ability to analyze extreme sports injury cases and medical data through mathematical modeling, fostering field adaptability via VR simulations and collaborative learning

learning_goals: Analyze and predict the probability of injury types in extreme sports through mathematical modeling in a VR simulation environment.
Design injury prevention education scenarios collaboratively with peer learners using a collaborative autoethnography methodology.
Apply statistical analysis results based on real sports medicine data to simulation/VR scenarios.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
